data.prompt:
You are an aspect categorization specialist.

**YOUR TASK:** Categorize physical aspects into the most appropriate categories from the provided taxonomy.

**UNDERSTANDING THE DATA:**
- Each aspect represents customer feedback about different physical product characteristics and attributes
- Categorize each aspect into the most appropriate category
- Use "OUT_OF_SCOPE" for aspects that don't fit well into any category
- Focus on business value and customer impact when making assignments

**AVAILABLE CATEGORIES:**
**AVAILABLE CATEGORIES:**
[C_0] Button Interface: Physical button controls, layouts, and activation methods including touch-activated interfaces, e.g. button layout changes, on/off buttons, scene selection buttons, touch-activated interfaces
[C_1] Slider Controls: Physical sliding mechanisms for dimming and control adjustment, e.g. smooth responsive sliders, stiff slider movement, slide bar operation
[C_2] Visual Indicators: LED lights, status indicators, and visual feedback elements on the device, e.g. blue LED indicator lights, green status lights, brightness of indicator symbols
[C_3] Physical Mounting: Installation hardware and mounting mechanisms including wall mounts and magnetic attachments, e.g. wall mount with screw or adhesive options, magnetic mounting strength, stick-on plates
[C_4] Electrical Connections: Wire connections, terminals, and electrical interface components, e.g. load wire marking, ground terminals, hot wire connections, push-in connections, wire routing difficulties
[C_5] Cover Components: Removable covers, face plates, and protective housing elements, e.g. cover plates that snap on, face plates breaking off, screw-secured covers, included wall plates
[C_6] Physical Dimensions: Size, depth, and spatial fit characteristics within electrical installations, e.g. optimal depth for wall box, compact form factor, fitting in electrical boxes
[C_7] Material Construction: Build materials, structural integrity, and manufacturing quality, e.g. polycarbonate construction, plastic quality, sturdy vs flimsy materials, solid construction
[C_8] Aesthetic Design: Visual appearance, color, and styling characteristics, e.g. modern sleek look, color matching issues, slim profile, clean design
[C_9] Mechanical Operation: Physical switch mechanisms, tactile feedback, and operational feel, e.g. rocker switch clicks, smooth quiet operation, squeaking sounds, satisfying click feedback
[C_10] Internal Mechanisms: Internal moving parts and adjustment components, e.g. rocker pivots breaking, toggle switches falling apart, thumbwheel dials, internal adjustment wheels
[C_11] Power Management: Battery life and power-related physical characteristics, e.g. battery lasting upwards of a year, power capacity specifications
[C_12] Magnetic Systems: Magnetic attachment and holding mechanisms, e.g. magnets holding remote to mount, magnetic strength between versions
[C_13] OUT_OF_SCOPE: Aspects that are too vague, generic, or unclear to categorize meaningfully


**CATEGORIZATION GUIDELINES:**
1. **Business Focus**: Think about what categories would be most valuable for business teams
2. **Customer Impact**: Consider how these aspects affect customer experience and satisfaction
3. **Strategic Value**: Choose categories that help prioritize product improvements and business decisions
4. **Clear Boundaries**: Each aspect should fit clearly into one category with no ambiguity
5. **OUT_OF_SCOPE Usage**: Use only for aspects that are truly unclear, too generic, or don't fit any meaningful category

**REQUIRED OUTPUT FORMAT:**
Return pure JSON mapping each aspect ID to its category ID:
{
  "1": "C_0",
  "2": "C_1", 
  "3": "OUT_OF_SCOPE",
  "4": "C_2",
  ...
}

**CRITICAL RULES:**
- **Complete Coverage**: Every aspect ID from the input must appear exactly once in the output
- **Valid Category IDs**: Use only the category IDs provided (C_0, C_1, etc.) or "OUT_OF_SCOPE"
- **Pure JSON**: Return only the JSON object - no explanations or formatting
- **No Duplicates**: Each aspect ID should appear exactly once
- **Strategic Thinking**: Consider business and customer value when making assignments



**PRODUCT CATEGORIES IN DATASET:** Dimmer Switches, Light Switches
Consider how physical aspects relate to customer needs across these 2 product categories.

**INPUT:**
[0] buttons: button layout changed between v1 and v2 versions
[1] buttons: top button for on/off
[2] buttons: bottom button changed from off to hue function
[3] buttons: one button for on/off
[4] buttons: center rocker for dimming
[5] buttons: button for scene selection
[6] magnets: magnets hold remote to mount with perfect strength
[7] magnets: magnet holding to housing not as good as v1
[8] design: slim profile
[9] design: new design looks awesome
[10] design: design puts features before usability
[11] design: shape not compatible between versions
[12] wall_mount: wall mount with screw option or 3M adhesive
[13] wall_mount: stick on plate for convenient install
[14] battery: battery lasts very long time upwards of a year
[15] build_quality: seems well-made
[16] appearance: modern and sleek design
[17] appearance: clean design
[18] build_quality: well made and sturdy construction
[19] build_quality: not flimsy
[20] build_quality: good quality material
[21] build_quality: high end appearance
[22] slider: smooth and responsive slider
[23] slider: easy to move slide bar
[24] slider: stiff slider movement
[25] buttons: big buttons
[26] wiring: load wires same color without proper marking
[27] cover_plate: cover plate difficult to snap on
[28] cover_plate: enclosed cover wouldn't stay on
[29] cover_plate: screw-secured cover
[30] screw_design: hidden screws
[31] size: optimal depth for wall box
[32] size: fits existing box easily
[33] Material: Made of cheap plastic
[34] Material: Made of polycarbonate that cracks
[35] Color: Off-white color instead of white
[36] Color: Gloss ivory color instead of gloss white

[57] Design: Deeper than regular switch

[61] Wiring: Requires specific electrical wiring
[62] Wiring: Supplied wire nuts and screws

[65] Components: Pull tab cutoff at bottom

[69] tactile_feedback: good "click" as they switch
[70] Construction Quality: Poor build quality with gaps developing

[72] Construction Quality: High quality feel

[76] Switch Design: Nice looking switch
[77] Switch Design: Neat look

[80] Switch Design: Looks off to the rear of the switches

[82] Internal Components: Pivot of the rocker broke on one side
[83] Internal Components: Toggle switch fell apart when tried to use
[84] Internal Components: Has thumbwheel dial under cover for adjustment
[85] Internal Components: Has wheel adjustment on inside to help adjust lowest dimmer setting
[86] Size: Switch base is really big making connections difficult to fit in electrical box
[87] Appearance: Simple, modern sleek look
[88] Appearance: Look nice
[89] Appearance: Well made complete set with cover plates and wire nuts
[90] Appearance: Beautiful instrument and well manufactured
[91] Face plate: Face plate has broken off from the switch
[92] Touch interface: Touch plate for dimming seems awkward - causes unintended dimming level changes
[93] Touch interface: Can slide finger instead of clicking for dimming
[94] Touch interface: Switch responds well to touch
[95] Touch interface: Physical dimmer feature is hit or miss - sometimes registers touch, sometimes doesn't
[96] Indicator light: Light on switch symbol should be brighter when light is on
[97] Indicator light: Status light won't turn on when switch is dead
[98] Indicator light: Green indicator light stays on even when switch stops working
[99] Wiring requirements: Requires neutral wire
[100] Wiring requirements: Extra pigtails and wire nuts create room issues in electrical box
[101] appearance: looks sleek
[102] appearance: looks great
[103] appearance: looks modern and beautiful
[104] appearance: looks good

[106] material: good material quality
[107] material: high quality material
[108] switch_mechanism: nice feel to the switch
[109] switch_mechanism: nice soft operation that is smooth and quiet
[110] switch_mechanism: squeaks when pushed
[111] switch_mechanism: spring inside is loud

[113] switch_mechanism: nice feeling switch
[114] cover_plate: wall plate is included
[115] cover_plate: cheap cover
